title: Memory Box

openaiSpec.name: memory_plugin

mode.description:
Required. Mode of operation:
- 'store': Add memories proactively when you detect important information or when the user uses '\m'.
- 'search': Use to find specific memories. This is the default mode for looking up information.
- 'load_all': ONLY use when explicitly requested by user. Never use this mode automatically.
- 'load_bucket': **Use this mode to load memories from a specific bucket.**

query.description: Search term to find specific memories. Required in 'search' mode. Only use search mode when you need to check for specific information and haven't loaded memories yet in this conversation.

bucket.description: Bucket name to store or load memories. Optional in all modes. When provided, it overrides the default bucket set in user settings. If not provided, the default bucket from settings will be used.

memory.description: Text to remember. Required in 'store' mode. Be succinct and focus on important details. Follow the formatting guidelines in the system prompt.

openaiSpec.description:
Memory Box stores and recalls user information for personalized interactions. Be proactive in storing relevant details without waiting for user prompts. If a message ends with '\m', treat it as a request to remember the preceding information. Always check loaded memories for relevant details before asking the user. Store information succinctly.

**Important:** The plugin uses the bucket specified in user settings by default. When the user explicitly mentions a different bucket in a message, use that bucket instead by providing it in the 'bucket' parameter.

Use 'search' mode only when you need to look up specific information and haven't loaded memories yet in this conversation. Once you've loaded memories using either 'load_all' or 'load_bucket', just check those directly instead of using search.

If unsure about storing information, ask the user if they want it remembered. Use appropriate modes and parameters to store or fetch memories. Display any returned alerts or error messages to the user.

userSettings.name: token
userSettings.label: User Auth Token
userSettings.description: Your auth token, visible on the Memory Box dashboard after logging in. Required.

userSettings.name: apiUrl
userSettings.label: API URL
userSettings.description: The Memory Box API URL. Only change this if instructed to do so.

userSettings.name: debug
userSettings.label: Debug Mode
userSettings.description: Enable debug mode for troubleshooting. Only turn this on when diagnosing issues.

userSettings.name: cacheEnabled
userSettings.label: Enable Caching
userSettings.description: Cache API responses to improve performance. Disable if you need real-time updates.
